content.text: ! [how] is she become as a widow
with her, they are become her enemies
that she had in the days
[Is it] nothing to you, all ye that pass
unto them, as thou hast done
unto me for all my transgressions
And he hath violently taken away
, as [if it were of] a garden
What thing shall I take to witness
to thee, that I may comfort
for thee: and they have not discovered
over thee, he hath set up
Surely against me is he turned
me about, that I cannot get out
; if so be there may be
, and it cometh to pass, [when] the Lord
for the punishment of his sins
to the roof of his mouth
For the punishment of the iniquity
, it is become like a stick
through unto thee: thou shalt be drunken
, what is come upon us: consider
over us: [there is] none that doth deliver
unto us, that we have sinned
thou us unto thee, O LORD
